concept.title: Guide to Derby Skates
concept.shortdesc: Roller derby is a competitive contact sport that is played on quad roller skates that are built for speed and flexibility. More equipment is used than just skates, but the skates are, of course, the most important piece of equipment--so quality matters.

conbody.p: There are many different skate brands, each with their own unique pros and cons. The range of quality and cost is wide, and as such, certain brands of skates may be more suited than others for beginners to the sport. Some brands of skates ship with low-quality wheels, plates, or bearings on them. If this is the case, higher-quality parts should be purchased and installed on the skates in place of the cheaper parts. The skates that are the highest quality and that cost the most typically don't need this. When purchasing skates, always consider the advantages of leather boots over vinyl. (Price ranges listed here do not reflect junior skate packages.)

If you are skating for recreational purposes or are joining a roller derby team and don't have a large budget, consider reaching out to your local derby players and buying or borrowing secondhand equipment. Even if you're buying a new pair of skates, you may decide that you want better quality or extra wheels, bearings, or other parts, and be able to get them cheaply.
